KnowledgeBase.Title: isCharAlphabetic
KnowledgeBase.ArgumentTypes: Character String Symbol Vector ByteVector Text Boolean
KnowledgeBase.RelatedFunctions: isType isChar isCharAlphanumeric isCharLowercase isCharName isCharNumeric isCharUppercase isCharWhitespace isString isText
KnowledgeBase.HumanKeywords: Character Alphabetic Object Uppercase Lowercase Name Underscore Numeric Alphanumeric Name Whitespace Boolean

Function.Description: The isCharAlphabetic function returns true if every character in the argument is an alphabetic Character; otherwise false is returned.

Brief.Overview: The isCharAlphabetic function returns true if every character in the argument {obj} is an alphabetic character. Otherwise the isCharAlphabetic function returns false.
Brief.Usage: The isCharAlphabetic function function is used to query an object to see if it contains only alphabetic characters.

Argument.Name: obj
Argument.AISTypes: Text, Character, String, Symbol, or ByteVector

Syntax.Return: If the object contains only alphabetic characters, true is returned. Otherwise false is returned.
